question:
You work for an international company and would like to spend six months working in its head office in another country


Write a letter to your manager. In your letter
1. explain why you want to work in the company's head office for six months
2. Say how your work could be done while you are away 
3. ask for his/her help i arranging it
text: This letter is to request for an oppertunity to work at our head office in sydney for six months. This will provide me more experiance on our product and it will help the company sales.

Let me explain in more details. Having a direct exposure to company products and our clients will allow me to gain more understanding of their needs and it will most definetly help to meet my targets. This will definetly have a positive affect on our sales. During these 6 months, Steve will be available and he has agreed to cover my dutides and look after my team.
I highly appriciate if you kindly discuss this with the head office and arrange this on be half of me. Please let me know if you need any further clarification.
I look forward to hear from you at your earlies convenience.

error_list.error_des: The word oppertunity is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
It appears that the word sydney may be a proper noun in this context. Consider capitalizing the word.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The word experiance is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It seems that details may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The indefinite article, a, may be redundant when used with the uncountable noun exposure in your sentence. Consider removing it.
The word definetly is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
The word definetly is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
